comments.body: Apparently, it is also considered beautiful. It is one of the wood types in higher demand, so it can be a little expensive.
I am ALWAYS for new wood types!
I'm into this, especially because ipe trees can have leaves of many beautiful bright colors, like purple, pink or yellow, and i think it would be amazing to have different colored leaves in the game

Excellent idea. The yellow leaves would completely change Minecraft landscapes to the better. The wood could be a bit more yellowish than regular oak. It would not only be great for decoration, but it would complement the new Cherry Wood set and the Mangrove set. Thinking on player expression and story-telling, it would improve representation of Latin-American players.
You worked really hard on this, I hope the developers find and consider this!!

This could be an enchantment
Yes! Great suggestion!
Yes great suggestion but in bedrock especially you need to be able to see a beacon from far not just 5 chunks or less.

My thoughts on this:

each layer retain current range/duration stats, but changes available effects
each block type (group) gives a higher tier functionality

all primary effects available from the basic pyramid (layers 1-3)
 > primary effects being: Speed, Haste, Strength, Jump Boost, Resistance
secondary effects available from the full pyramid (layer 4)
 > secondary effects being: Regeneration, Fire Resistance, Night Vision, Saturation, Slow Falling

Iron/Gold give potency of I for primary effects
Emerald/Diamond/Netherite give potency of II for primary effects

For example, to get Haste II, you would need any size pyramid built fully out of Emerald/Diamond/Netherite
Continuing with this example, a full size beacon made out of Emerald/Diamond/Netherite could give Haste II and Night Vision if desired

For the shear rarity of it, perhaps Netherite could double the range of the beacon, at any size (as long as it's the only material used)?
Also, notice how I didn't put any stipulation on material to activate the beacon? I would say for this to just keep it as is
I think the higher tier materials should give you more options... at this point netherite is king.  I'd love for a beacon to give creative flight mode.

Beacons should NOT let you fly like in creative, at least not passively since it would allow anyone else in range to fly. Instead, being in the beacon beam should float you upwards as a free way to gain height for elytra gliding (no damage taken if you fall out, crouching would descend you slowly)
Also, NO hostile mobs should spawn within its radius to reward players with peace of mind & give clarity to be creative.

Maybe creative flight can be granted temporarily within range by offering a nether star or heart of the sea, lasting longer depending on the pyramid.
or maybe this is a new feature for wool armor because leather armor can be dyed and it may seem repetitive.
That is a cool idea but what color would it be you didn't spesafy
Fudge I was gonna suggest this not the trapped chest part but that's a wonderful addition. Voted! :D
I feel like it shouldn't instantly explode if you just open it, especially since you could hook up a clever redstone device to do so (I feel that it would be more balanced).
Great idea!  The top should be open so you can see the gunpowder.  That let's people who like to build custom maps (me) use it for decoration.
I think it should have a different texture than a normal barrel.

Clarified subject to help search results.

Thanks for your contribution.
Make it 64, as Notch Apples are extremely rare, and anyone with a exp farm would have an infinite amount. This is just a slight nerf that would have to be made for this to even be fair.
Write that down! Write that down!!!
I had the same idea!!
Or crafting it with 4 gold ingots and 4 gold blocks (equivalent to 40 gold ingots) surrounding the regular golden apple.
That idea is way better than my idea
Should have actual enchants like saturation II, or absorption IV. Kind of like how you enchant tools
maybe gold insted of lapis or both but that would be wierd mechanics
i suggest replacing enchanted golden apple into crystal apple. see my far land post for more detail.

I really like the idea and it only makes sense. "Enchanted Golden Apple" already has the word "enchanted" in it, so it's only logical to be able to create one by... well, enchanting a golden apple. It'd also make it easier to craft those banners with Mojang logos ^^ Oh, and it'd help completing that one advancement for which one has to eat every food in the game.

But, I'd make it 64 or even 100 levels. These apples are very powerful and should stay rare. And with an XP grinder, level 100 is very possible.
No... being able to easily replicate/craft/make Enchanted Golden Apples is too OP. It's why they removed the crafting recipe.

I think elevating the maximum amount of levels needed for a single item breaks consistency, so I don't like the Idea of the enchantment needing 100 levels in an enchantment table. What does however sometimes require mode levels is the anvil. I therefore think it is better if you need to combine a stack of golden apples with an enchanted book of apple enchantment (of however it might be called) in an anvil. This process would then require something like 64 or 100 levels. I think the anvil is better, since it already combines stuff. Combining a stack of "normal" golden apples into a better one therefore only makes sense. I also think, that this would give the enchantment table a purpose again. Since 1.14 you can easily get every enchantment just from villagers. Having to use an enchantment table again to get a bunch of junk books until you finally get the book of apple enchantment plus a lot of junk books would make this game mechanic much more interesting again.

Therefore I would suggest that you first need to enchant books at level 30 in an enchantment table until you get a boom of apple enchantment (terrible name but maybe someone has a better idea). You would then need to combine this book with 64 golden apples (which need 8 stacks of gold ingots) using 64 levels of xp to get an enchanted golden apple.
Make 120 levels or 30 levels per buff it gives

Skating would be a fun & festive addition to holiday-themed worlds. Many resource packs have tried to emulate a skating rink, but without unique mechanics of skating, it never comes close.
It would be a fast travel method across icy lakes and rivers.
Combined with a Frost Walker enchantment, one could skate anywhere.

I'm going to make a serious argument to why this should be in the game. Ice Skates have i been around since 1000 bce. It's not something newer or modern like pizza or a smartphone. Ice skates were used to help people get acrossed frozen rivers. So in game it will help players travel across large icy areas giving them more control over the ice and faster propulsion. When figure skating was introduced, skates with short blades and a curve at the end was develop to provide skaters with quick turns. In game, players should have the option of quick turns but it takes a lot of skill. I also believe ice skates are a nice jesture to the community. Maybe add them during a holiday update. This way players can have fun and show of their skills during the holidays. It's one of those detours that makes the game fun.
I would love to see this added, and with the Caves and cliffs update Ice caves may be possible which would make Ice Skates perfect for this update.

Same attributes as leather boots, including dye colors, powder snow walking, enchantable with Mending I, Unbreaking III, and Frost Walker I/II, would provide the same speed effect as Soul Speed I/II/III enchantment but only on ice, and would provide slowness effect like walking on soul sand/soul soil when walking on non ice blocks.

^^^Slowness effect on non-ice^^^ was exactly my thoughts, pain in the neck to try and run with ice skates.

If they do this and roller-skates, roller-skates are the opposite... Except instead of slowing on ice you lose all traction/grip and fall down hard.

these are some neat ideas. while testing splash water on my own i noticed that it doesnt seem to do damage to magma cubes or blazes, which i think it should do. I also think it should remove the fire status from the player, or from other players that are on fire
I think temporarily hydrating farmland could also do something/work
And also to damage blazes, magma cubes and ender men
What if they could make crops grow, like bonemeal

Besides for nether mobs and endermrn they should also damage snow golem, make bees return to there hives, activate conduit powers if it's near by, put out players/mobs that are on fire (as others have suggest), possibly add a layer to a cauldron, pretty much anything rain can do.
The idea for riptide should probably only work with lingering water

When you are in a hot biome for about 5 minutes (nether included), you will slowly lose health and the corners of the screen will turn orange (similar to powdered snow effect).

Drinking a water bottle will remove any burning effect, put out fire and give more time until you heat up again.

Water bottles stack to 2
Splash water bottles put out fire within a 5 block radius.

Splash water bottles damage nether mobs, endermen, snow golem, make bees return to their hive, activate nearby conduits, put out fire on players/mobs, scare cats and defuse creepers during the exploding animation, meaning they won't explode for 12 seconds

A player could stand inside a Lingering Water Bottle and use the Riptide strike.

Less durability, slower, fall to the ground quicker, or something. Also, there would be no fall damage or vetical direction control.
I fail to see how this would improve the game in any way, so no support from me. Thanks for the reply, though, and thanks for contributing!

I think a craftable early-game glider would be interesting.  It definitely wouldn't glide as well as the elytra, and you should have to hold it in your hands (so it would be a hang-glider), so you wouldn't be able to use rockets or punch bows or any other means of propulsion.  They should also make sure that any infinite flying tricks that elytra pros use would not work with the hang-glider.

As simple hang glider would be nice to use is Jungle biome's or in Mesa Plateau's. Construction could be from the following, String, Sticks and Leather. The distance you can glide could be dependent on how high you are compared to the ground. Maybe drop 1 block for every block flown.

MacchuPicchu96, what don't you like about this idea? It's like wooden tools, but with elytra. It's way worse than a better alternative that requires little materials. Instead of going to the end for wings, you can use some string, leather, and sticks for a petty hang glider. C'mon, buddy. Think about it.
This is a great idea. There should be far better ways of travelling though the maps that can be built

It would be cool if the downsides to it would be you couldn't use fireworks with it and it would break and I think it would be cool if the recipe was like some string wool sticks possibly some iron or gold and nuggets here or there.

Overall, I feel like Elytra was somewhat of a missed opportunity. I'd much rather have gliders that are not as powerful, accessible early on (perhaps crafted with phantom membranes or leather).

Elytra is somewhat broken; it can be easily exploited to lag servers, and. If the player gets an Elytra, all other means of transport become redundant. Gliders would be much more accessible to players, since not all people want to beat the Ender dragon and then search for End Cities through, let's be honest, boring dimension.

This new means of transport would enable the player to glide, making use of new mountain terrain, and much more vertical and spacious caves , without rocket boosting. It would be slower and not as durable; perhaps this item that could be held, and not be worn in a chest slot.

Overall, it provides the playerbase with a fun and accessible way to experience the true freedom and beauty of Minecraft without making it out of balance.

I do like greek myths but it does not really fit with the lore of Minecraft. Maybe they'll make a spin-off game like Minecraft Dungeons about Greek myths.

A way it could be implemented though is by adding Cyclopes to Minecraft.

They would live underground in a cave biome called TARTARUS.

In this biome you would find big forges full of Magma blocks and Anvils these Cyclopes would be Hostile mobs that if Killed have a chance of dropping 1 of 3 items

In the myths the Gods were trying to defeat the Titans and they needed weopons. So they asked the Elder cyclopes and the Hundred-Handed ones for help. They got their weopons and defeated the Titans.

If this was added it would connect Minecraft to ancient Greece and all that weird stuff where Gods have children with their sisters though and that is not a good thing for a game played by children.
Do you want tinker construct to be implanted in the basic game?

I personally believe adding Tinkers' Construct to the base game is a great idea. Doing so would add more ores, more tools and change how they are created, as well as add more "functionality" to all the current ores(i.e. melting gold into a liquid and turning it into fountains). Adding such a thing would also bring a sense of industry to Minecraft, which would in turn inspire more ideas like this.

Now we get to the How-to's... Maybe reach out to the creators of Tinkers' Construct so that maybe they can make a few tweaks to get it console ready (speaking on behalf of console players here)? Or develop something similar... Just throwing out ideas here... This all could be a lot of work, but I believe the player base would love the end result.
I do not know about this...

Yes, Yes, Yes, All of the Yes! Bringing in Tinker's Construct as an addition would be an incredible idea. As 380902559291 put it, it would bring multiple ores, tools, weapons, and gadgets to the game. It would also add in a "level by use" function to the utilities and items, making them more multi-purpose and reasonable. One person who just made an iron or steel cleaver wouldn't really stack to someone who had been using one for about an hour. Plus repairing tools would be made easier just by using the original material in the tinker's table along with the damaged item. Of course to make it fair, you would still need to use EXP to make said repairs and would cost less EXP if you used a similar make of the item. It would also be a great learning experience for the kids to learn what metals combine to make even better metals like coal and iron to make steel. I feel that we could make better PvP servers that implement these new weapons and tools for a more reasonable combat and mining tier list. Anyways, that's my two cents and I hope Mojang and Microsoft read over this post and gives it some thought.
I agree with everyone on this that sounds like a fantastic idea add this to the base game please

Dont you put like it will be hard to craft but will be great thing to helpe you mining put a tnt pickecks i know is to modder like cars i thing you will not put in the end update or jungle update or in any update oh and i all most forgot i will relly love if you do an update on the oak biome because mojang players are angry at you but in 1.20 add this thigs but if not i ts okay you can this new sword or something be awesome but thats all good like at the hard work mojang.
I guess my only concern is how you would differentiate between this and normal maps, both in crafting and in name.

Bedrock already has two different maps, the map and the locator map.  One is crafted like the java map, the other is crafted with 9 paper.  This map could be called something like the gridless map and would be crafted with something else in the center instead of the compass.  Im not sure it matters what.  Maybe a sugar, maybe a redstone dust.

I would suggest just replacing the bedrock map that is crafted without a compass with this map that does not snap to a grid, but the map without a location marker probably has its uses.
Interesting... not something I feel is absolutely needed in the game but I'll give it a vote because it could end up being useful
This is relateable. I would like that too. I also think they should make it for when you extend a map it doesn't expand mostly one direction. Maps really do need to be fixed like this.

I would love something like this, nothing worse than building something that would look great on a map in a neat scenic location only to find it's in the corner of the map, requiring 4 zoomed in maps to get a nice picture of it.

Perhaps make it so right clicking a map on a cartography table will center that map to that cartography table (unless it is a locked map).... similar to how you can right click a map on a banner to pin the banner on the map.

It might even only work if the map has not yet been started, so you right click a fresh map on a cartography table to create a map centered on that block.
you must use the give command to get them. but they are there.
Chido
use command /give @s barrier

Hello!

Here is my list of Ideas and Additions I came up with for the Barrier Block. (December 4th, 2019 Washington)

 

What would Minecraft be if it were ONLY blocks and nothing else? Pretty boring actually. Thill fun, but not as exciting.

We have things like stairs, which are basically 3/4 of a block, fences, water, lava, End Rods, Heads, Sand, Gravel, Beds, Gates, Doors, Portals, Torches, Signs, Scaffolding, Switches, Levers, Buttons, Pressure Plates, Webs, Rails, Slime Blocks, Honey Blocks, Cactus, Magma Block, Armour Stand, Fire, and any other block that does something when the player makes context with it.

But the only kind of Barrier Block we have is a boring, singular, cube block.

I would suggest putting everything I mentioned above into a Barrier Block that works in both ways. If the things I mentioned above were too much, then the ones I feel is a must, are Barrier Stairs, Barrier Fence, Barrier Gate, Barrier Water, Barrier Lava, Barrier Torch, Barrier Portal, Barrier Sign, and Barrier block with gravity applied to it, Barrier Rails, Barrier Ice, Barrier Blue Ice, Barrier Packed Ice.

Honorable mentions:

Barrier T.N.T., Barrier Piston, Barrier Sticky Piston, Barrier Bedrock (double unbreakable), Barrier Conduit, Barrier Barrier, Barrier Beakon, Barrier Beakon Light, Barrier, End Portal, Barrier Dispenser, Barrier Dropper, and Barrier Plants.

(I'm sorry, I must continue the rest of what I was saying in a new comment or reply; due to the 1,500 character limit.)

It is possible to get barrier blocks in game. However, it is only available in a world with cheats on. In order to obtain these blocks, you must but this command in either the chat or in a command block (also only obtainable with cheats): /give @s barrier. This block is invisible and invincible and only viewable in creative mode with it in your hand. I hope this helps!
Custom inventory: design a chests inventory. Custom crafting: already available.
This feature should be added so badly! Same goes for custom entities...

this times 1000! having custom blocks added, even if they only at the moment can only be used for decoration would make life so much easier for people trying to add custom blocks for vanilla players that either don't want to or can't install mods

I think a simple way Mojang could do this is just by adding a block with a whole bunch of block states so that you can mix and match the block states and give each one different textures. Right now people do that with note blocks but players change those by right-clicking them, which is a problem. 
It would also be nice if one of the block states (or components) was what the block is best mined with, but if that's complicated I'm sure people would be okay with that coming later or being split up into a few different blocks with the same block state concept
It would also be good if we could add textures with resource packs and in these datapacks we could add new NBT tags and new block states.
